recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tbsp water
cooking_method: 1. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
2. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
3. Add doubanjiang, soy sauce, and chicken stock.
4. Gently add tofu and simmer for a few minutes.
5. Thicken with cornstarch mixture and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
cooking_method: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
2. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
3. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
4. Add doubanjiang, sesame paste, soy sauce, sugar, and chicken stock.
5. Combine the cooked noodles with the sauce and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tbsp water
cooking_method: 1. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
2. Add chicken and cook until browned.
3. Add soy sauce, Chinkiang vinegar, Shaoxing wine, and sugar, and stir until the chicken is coated.
4. Add chopped green onions, roasted peanuts, and red chili flakes and stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Thicken with cornstarch mixture and drizzle with sesame oil before serving.

recipes.name: Ma Po Eggplant
ingredients: 2 medium-sized eggplants, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 tbsp fermented black beans, rinsed and chopped
1 tbsp cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tbsp water
cooking_method: 1. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
2. Add chopped eggplants and stir-fry until slightly browned.
3. Add fermented black beans and doubanjiang and stir until fragrant.
4. Add chicken broth and bring to a simmer.
5. Thicken with cornstarch mixture and add sugar.
6. Drizzle with sesame oil before serving.

recipes.name: Sichuan Hot Pot
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Fill a hot pot with water and bring it to a boil.
2. Add sliced ginger, garlic, and scallions.
3. Add the meat, fish, and tofu to the hot pot and cook until done.
4. Add the vegetables and cook until tender.
5. In a small bowl, mix together vegetable oil, Sichuan peppercorn oil, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, Chinkiang vinegar, and sugar.
6. Dip cooked ingredients into the sauce before eating.

recipes.name: Chow Mein
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cook the noodles in boiling water for 3-4 minutes, then drain. 2. Heat a wok over high heat and add the beef. Stir-fry until browned. 3. Add the onions, carrots, and celery and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. 4. Add the noodles and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. 5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Hot and Sour Soup
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a large pot. 
2. Add the pork, bamboo shoots, and mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes. 
3. Add the rice vinegar and stir. 
4. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Mongolian Beef
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Toss the steak in cornstarch until fully coated. 
2. Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the steak and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned. 
3. Add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry for another minute. 
4. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Lemon Chicken
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and toss in cornstarch until fully coated. 
2. Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned. 
3. Add the honey and lemon juice and stir-fry for another minute. 
4. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Lay the fish on a heatproof plate and sprinkle with soy sauce and rice wine. 2. Top the fish with ginger and scallions. 3. Steam the fish over high heat for 12-15 minutes. 4. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Singaporean Slaw
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Toss together all of the ingredients in a large bowl. 2. Top with the dressing of your choice. 3. Serve cold.

recipes.name: Steamed Black Cod
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Place the black cod fillets in a heatproof dish. 2. Mix together the sake, soy sauce, mirin, and ginger in a bowl. 3. Pour the mixture over the fish. 4. Steam the fish for 10-12 minutes. 5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chinese Sausage Fried Rice
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat a wok over high heat and add the Chinese sausages. Stir-fry until browned. 2. Add the frozen peas and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. 3. Push the sausage and peas to the side of the wok and add the beaten eggs to the center. Scramble until cooked. 4. Add the cooked rice and soy sauce and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes. 5. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Lobster Salad with Grapefruit and Avocado
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Toss together all of the ingredients in a large bowl. 2. Serve cold.

recipes.name: Crispy Duck
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the oven to 375°F. 2. Prick the skin of the duck all over with a fork. 3. Mix together the honey, soy sauce, rice wine, and ginger in a small bowl. 4. Brush the mixture all over the duck. 5. Roast the duck in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the skin is crispy and the meat is cooked through. 6. Let the duck rest for 10 minutes before carving. 7. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Lobster Wontons
recipes.cooking_method: 1. In a bowl, mix together the lobster meat, cream cheese, scallions, soy sauce, and ginger. 2. Place a small spoonful of the mixture in the center of each wonton wrapper. 3. Brush the edges of the wrapper with water and fold in half to form a triangle. Press the edges together to seal. 4. Heat the oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F. 5. Fry the wontons until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes. 6. Drain on paper towels. 7. Serve hot with sweet chili sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Asian-style Grilled Salmon
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. 2. In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, mirin, honey, ginger, garlic, and sesame oil. 3. Place the salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over them. 4. Marinate the salmon for 15-20 minutes. 5. Remove the salmon from the marinade and place on the grill, skin-side down. 6. Grill for 5-7 minutes, until the skin is crispy. 7. Flip the salmon over and grill for another 2-3 minutes, until cooked through. 8. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Szechuan Green Beans
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 2. Add the green beans and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until they start to brown. 3. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for another 30 seconds. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, and chili garlic sauce. 5. Pour the sauce over the green beans and stir-fry for another minute, until the beans are coated and the sauce is heated through. 6. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Seared Scallops with Soba Noodles
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Cook the soba noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. 2. Season the scallops with salt and pepper. 3. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add the scallops and sear until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. 4. In a small bowl, whisk together the sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and ginger. 5. Toss the noodles with the dressing. 6. Serve the scallops on top of the noodles, garnished with scallions and cilantro.

recipes.name: Five-Spice Beef Stir-Fry
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 2. Add the ginger and garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 3. Add the beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned. 4. Add the bell pepper and onion and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes. 5. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, and five-spice powder. 6. Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until the sauce thickens. 7. Garnish with sliced scallions and serve hot.

recipes.name: Crispy Shrimp Toast
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Finely chop the shrimp and mix with egg white, cornstarch, water chestnuts, scallions, salt, and pepper. Spread the mixture on each slice of bread.
2. Cut each slice into quarters and coat with sesame seeds.
3. Heat oil in a wok or frying pan to 350°F. Fry the shrimp toasts until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
4. Serve hot with sweet chili sauce.

recipes.name: Steamed Lobster with Garlic and Rice Vermicelli
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
2. Rinse lobster and pat dry. Cut the lobster in half lengthwise.
3. Mix garlic, canola oil, Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, sugar, white pepper, sesame oil, and cornstarch in a small bowl.
4. Place the lobster on a heatproof plate and spread the garlic mixture over the meat.
5. Place the plate in a steamer basket and steam over high heat until the lobster is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
6. Scatter scallions over the lobster and serve with rice vermicelli.

recipes.name: Sichuan-Style Stir-Fried Green Beans
cooking_method: Wash the green beans and trim off the ends. Cut the beans in half if they are too long.
Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 10 seconds.
Add the green beans and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they are cooked but still crunchy.
Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.
Add the soy sauce, sugar, and salt and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Wok-Fried Fish Fillet with Spring Onion and Ginger
cooking_method: Coat the fish fillet slices in cornstarch and shake off the excess.
Heat the oil in a wok over high heat. Add the fish fillet slices and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly browned.
Add the spring onions and ginger and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.
Add the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and salt and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the fish is cooked through.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Beggar's Chicken
cooking_method: Rinse the chicken and pat it dry. In a large bowl, mix together the Shaoxing wine, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, ginger, scallions, and garlic. Add the chicken and marinate for at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the chicken on all sides until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Line a baking sheet with the lotus leaves. Stuff the chicken with the remaining marinade and wrap it tightly in the leaves. Tie with kitchen twine.
Spread a layer of coarse salt on the baking sheet and place the wrapped chicken on top. Cover the chicken completely with more salt.
Bake for 1 1/2 - 2 hours, until the chicken is cooked through and the salt crust is hard. Let the chicken cool for 10-15 minutes before cracking open the crust.
Serve the chicken with steamed rice and vegetables.

recipes.name: Pork Buns
ingredients: 2 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons active dry yeast
6 3/4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
1/2 cup rendered pork fat or vegetable shortening, at room temperature
recipes.cooking_method: Mix sugar, salt and yeast with 1 1/2 cups warm water. Let sit until foamy, about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, whisk flour and dry milk. Add yeast mixture, pork fat and 1/2 cup water; mix until a dough forms. Transfer to a floured surface; knead until smooth, 10 minutes. Transfer to a greased bowl; cover with a damp towel. Let rise in a warm spot until doubled, 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Mix light and dark soy sauces, vegetable oil, garlic, sesame oil, hoisin sauce, chile-garlic paste and rice vinegar in a bowl. Mix sesame paste, sugar, soy sauces, ginger, scallions and chicken stock in another bowl. Divide dough into 20 pieces. Roll each into a 4-to-5-inch disk; brush with oil mixture. Fold in half; press to seal. Put on a baking sheet; let rise 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Bake buns until light brown, 25 minutes. Dip pork in sesame mixture; serve in buns with pickled cucumbers.

recipes.name: Momofuku Ramen
ingredients: 2-inch piece ginger, peeled and thinly sliced
2 scallions, whites and greens separated, thinly sliced
1 lb fresh or dried ramen noodles
1/2 lb smoked pork belly, cut into 1/4-inch slices
cooking_method: In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, ginger, garlic, and scallion whites and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add shiro and aka miso and stir to combine.
Add stock, soy sauce, sake, and mirin and bring to a simmer.
In a separate pot, cook ramen noodles according to package instructions.
Divide noodles among four bowls and top with pork belly, bamboo shoots, and scallion greens.
Carefully lower eggs into the simmering broth and cook for 6 minutes. Remove eggs from broth and let cool for a few minutes before peeling and slicing in half.
Ladle hot broth into each bowl and top with a halved egg and nori. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Bo ssam (Korean-style boiled pork belly)
ingredients: 1 head of garlic, cut in half crosswise
cooking_method: Mix the salt, sugar, and peppercorns in a bowl. Rub the mixture all over the pork belly and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour.
Rinse the pork belly and place it in a large pot. Add enough water to cover the pork by 1 inch.
Add the onion, carrot, garlic, and ginger to the pot. Bring the water to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Simmer, covered, for 3 to 4 hours, or until the pork is tender.
Meanwhile, make the dipping sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together the doenjang, gochujang, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, and water.
Remove the pork from the pot and let it rest for 10 minutes. Slice the pork into 1/4-inch-thick pieces and arrange on a platter.
Serve the pork with Bibb lettuce leaves, kimchi, and the dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Fried chicken (Korean-style with spicy glaze)
ingredients: 2 pounds bone-in chicken wings or drumettes
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, salt, black pepper, baking powder, garlic powder, onion powder, smoked paprika, and cayenne pepper.
Add the chicken to the mixing bowl and toss to coat evenly.
Transfer the chicken to the prepared baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes, flipping the chicken halfway through.

While the chicken is baking, make the glaze by whisking together the gochujang, honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes, until slightly thickened.
Remove the chicken from the oven and brush the glaze over the chicken. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, until the glaze is sticky and caramelized.
Sprinkle the sesame seeds and chopped scallions over the chicken and serve hot.

recipes.name: Soy Sauce Eggs (Ajitsuke Tamago)
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Gently add the eggs and cook for exactly 6 minutes and 50 seconds. Drain the eggs and immediately transfer them to a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process.
2. In a small saucepan, combine the soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and garlic. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool.
3. Once the eggs are cool, peel them and place them in a plastic bag. Pour the cooled marinade over the eggs and seal the bag, removing as much air as possible. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
4. To serve, slice the eggs in half and serve with ramen, rice, or as a snack.

recipes.name: Shakshuka
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped onions and red bell pepper and sauté until softened.
2. Add minced garlic and sauté for an additional minute.
3. Pour in a can of diced tomatoes and stir in cumin.
4. Let the mixture simmer until the sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.
5. Use a spoon to make wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well.
6. Cover the skillet and let the eggs cook until the whites are set and the yolks are cooked to your liking.
7. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with crusty bread.

recipes.name: Roasted Cauliflower with Tahini and Za'atar
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets with the olive oil, salt, and black pepper until well coated. Spread the cauliflower out in a single layer on a baking sheet.
3. Roast the cauliflower in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, about 25 minutes.
4. While the cauliflower is roasting, mix the tahini, lemon juice, and za'atar in a small bowl until well combined.
5. Drizzle the tahini mixture over the roasted cauliflower and sprinkle with the chopped parsley. Serve hot or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Butternut Squash and Tahini Spread
ingredients: 1 small butternut squash, peeled and chopped into 1-inch cubes
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. Toss the butternut squash cubes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil and spread on a baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and golden brown.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, garlic, remaining olive oil, and maple syrup until smooth.
4. Once the butternut squash is roasted, let it cool for a few minutes and then transfer to a food processor.
5. Add the tahini mixture to the food processor and pulse until smooth and creamy.
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Black Pepper Tofu
cooking_method: Cut the tofu into small cubes and coat with cornstarch.
In a large pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Fry the tofu until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the tofu from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté the garlic, onion, and bell peppers until softened.
Add the soy sauce, oyster sauce, black pepper, and sugar to the pan.
Stir well to combine the sauce ingredients.
Add the tofu back to the pan and stir to coat with the sauce.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until the tofu is heated through.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve with rice.

recipes.name: Lemon and Herb Couscous with Dried Apricots and Almonds
cooking_method: In a large bowl, combine the couscous, boiling water, salt, and black pepper.
Stir in the olive oil and lemon juice and mix well.
Cover and let stand for 5 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed.
Fluff the couscous with a fork and stir in the parsley, mint, scallions, apricots, and almonds.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs, cut into small cubes
cooking_method: Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through, about 5-6 minutes.
Remove chicken from wok and set aside.
In the same wok, add more oil if needed and stir-fry bell peppers, onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant and slightly softened, about 2-3 minutes.
Add crushed chili peppers and stir-fry for another minute.
Add chicken back to wok and stir to combine with vegetables.
Add peanuts and stir-fry for another minute.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve over rice.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
cooking_method: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
2. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
3. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
4. Add doubanjiang, sesame paste, soy sauce, sugar, and chicken stock.
5. Combine the cooked noodles with the sauce and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Char Siu Pork Belly
cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, Chinese five-spice powder, rice vinegar, garlic, ginger, and vegetable oil to make the marinade.
3. Place the pork belly in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over it, making sure to coat it evenly. Cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
4. Remove the pork belly from the marinade and place it on a baking rack set over a baking sheet. Reserve the marinade.
5. Roast the pork belly for 45-50 minutes, until the skin is crisp and the meat is cooked through. Baste the pork belly with the reserved marinade every 10-15 minutes.
6. Remove the pork belly from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Sichuan-style Green Beans
cooking_method: 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and blanch for 2-3 minutes, until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse with cold water.
2. In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over high heat. Add the garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
3. Add the doubanjiang and stir-fry for another 30 seconds, until the oil is red and fragrant.
4. Add the green beans and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until well coated with the sauce.
5. Add the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and sesame oil and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until the beans are tender-crisp and the sauce is thick and glossy.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water to make a slurry. Add it to the wok and stir-fry for another 30 seconds, until the sauce has thickened and coats the beans evenly.
7. Garnish with green onions, cilantro, and sliced red chili pepper (if using). Serve hot over rice.

recipes.name: Stir-fried Beef with Oyster Sauce
ingredients: 1 lb flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain
1 tbsp Shaoxing wine or dry sherry
cooking_method: 1. In a bowl, toss the sliced beef with cornstarch until well coated. Set aside.
2. Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
3. Add the sliced beef and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, until browned on all sides.
4. Add the sliced bell peppers and onion and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together the oyster sauce, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine or dry sherry, sugar, and beef broth or water.
6. Add the sauce to the wok and stir-fry for another minute or two, until the sauce has thickened and coats the beef and vegetables evenly.
7. Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot over rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Parmesan
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Pound chicken breasts to even thickness.
Mix bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese in a shallow dish.
Dip chicken in beaten egg, then coat in bread crumb mixture.
Place chicken in a baking dish and bake for 25 minutes.
Remove from oven and top with marinara sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Return to oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into 2-inch pieces
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 325°F.
Cook bacon in a Dutch oven until crispy, then remove and set aside.
Add beef to the Dutch oven and cook until browned on all sides, then remove and set aside.
Add onion and carrots to the Dutch oven and cook until softened.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add wine, beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf to the Dutch oven.
Add beef and bacon back to the Dutch oven, then cover and bake in the oven for 2-3 hours or until beef is tender.
In a separate pan, sauté mushrooms in butter until golden brown.
Sprinkle flour over mushrooms and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add mushroom mixture to the Dutch oven and stir to combine.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Pad Thai
ingredients: 1 block firm tofu, cut into small cubes
cooking_method: Soak the rice noodles in hot water for 15-20 minutes until soft.
In a small bowl, mix together the fish sauce, tamarind paste, and brown sugar.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add the shrimp, chicken, and tofu and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes until cooked through.
Push the ingredients to one side of the wok and pour the beaten eggs into the other side.
Scramble the eggs until cooked, then mix with the other ingredients.
Add the rice noodles, bean sprouts, scallions, and chopped peanuts to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.
Pour the fish sauce mixture over the noodles and toss to combine.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
cooking_method: In a large bowl, whisk together the yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Add the chicken to the bowl and stir to coat in the marinade.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 8 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a baking sheet with foil and place the chicken pieces on the sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
Add the onion and cook for 5-7 minutes until softened.
Add the garlic, ginger, turmeric, and garam masala and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the crushed tomatoes and bring to a simmer.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the heavy cream and chopped cilantro.
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and stir to coat.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
cooking_method: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente.
While the pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Add the pancetta and cook for 5-7 minutes until crispy.
Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.
When the spaghetti is done, reserve 1/4 cup of the pasta water and drain the rest.
Add the pasta to the skillet with the pancetta and garlic and toss to coat.
Remove the skillet from the heat and pour the egg mixture over the pasta, stirring quickly to coat the pasta.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little of the reserved pasta water to thin it out.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Kung Pao Chicken
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tbsp water
cooking_method: 1. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
2. Add chicken and cook until browned.
3. Add soy sauce, Chinkiang vinegar, Shaoxing wine, and sugar, and stir until the chicken is coated.
4. Add chopped green onions, roasted peanuts, and red chili flakes and stir-fry for a few minutes.
5. Thicken with cornstarch mixture and drizzle with sesame oil before serving.

recipes.name: Mapo Tofu
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch, dissolved in 1 tbsp water
cooking_method: 1. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
2. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
3. Add doubanjiang, soy sauce, and chicken stock.
4. Gently add tofu and simmer for a few minutes.
5. Thicken with cornstarch mixture and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Steamed Fish with Ginger and Scallions
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Lay the fish on a heatproof plate and sprinkle with soy sauce and rice wine. 2. Top the fish with ginger and scallions. 3. Steam the fish over high heat for 12-15 minutes. 4. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Dan Dan Noodles
cooking_method: 1. Cook the noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
2. In a pan, heat up Sichuan peppercorn oil and sauté minced ginger and garlic until fragrant.
3. Add ground pork and cook until browned.
4. Add doubanjiang, sesame paste, soy sauce, sugar, and chicken stock.
5. Combine the cooked noodles with the sauce and sprinkle with chopped green onions.

recipes.name: Braised Pork Belly
cooking_method: Preheat oven to 325°F.
Cut the pork belly into 2-inch pieces.
In a Dutch oven, combine water, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, green onions, star anise, and cinnamon stick.
Add the pork belly to the Dutch oven and bring to a boil over high heat.
Cover the Dutch oven with a lid and transfer to the preheated oven.
Braise for 2 hours, or until the pork belly is tender.
Remove the pork belly from the braising liquid and set aside.
Strain the braising liquid and discard the solids.
Return the liquid to the Dutch oven and simmer over high heat until the sauce is reduced to a syrupy consistency.
Return the pork belly to the Dutch oven and toss to coat with the sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice and your favorite vegetable.
